name: ECON 166A
title: Game Theory and Applications I
description: Introduces modern game theory, including applications in social science, biology, and engineering. Topics include extensive form, strategic form, mixed strategies, incomplete information, repeated games, evolutionary games, and simulation techniques.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): STAT 5, STAT 7, STAT 17 or ECON 113; and AM 11B or ECON 11B, or MATH 11B, MATH 19B, STAT 131 or CSE 107. Enrollment is restricted to juniors and seniors.

class_notes: Enroll in lecture and associated discussion section. Also offered as CSE 166A. ECON 166A and CSE 166A offer students the same credit for their programmatic requirements. If ECON 166A is full, then enroll in CSE 166A; if CSE 166A is full, then enroll in ECON 166A. We recommend against using CSE 166A waitlist--as attrition is less likely to occur.
